data.title: Lunch
data.text: Great Mexican pkace to eat. Felt like family here. Lots of folks enjoying the quizine. Good selection,  tastes great, and appealing appearance.

data.title: Thursday Chili Rellenos Special
data.text: Some of the best Rellenos in the Valley.  Dine early or call in an reserve your Rellenos.  They do run out... EVERY Thursday.

data.title: Good depending on cook
data.text: I went there order a botana for one person. I was served abunch of chips and cheese and enough meat to maybe fill a stripes taco. For $15.00 it is really not worth it. The flavor of what i did get was good but not worth it. Place is pretty pricey much better mexican food around for less money

data.title: Dinner out in Mission
data.text: Great prices and homemade food.  Always welcoming and friendly service.  Breakfast tacos, with a choice of fillings, and it seems to be a favorite of the winter Texans.  Just across from the post office with plenty of parking.  Can also get your car detailed across the street while you are eating.

data.title: A good family restaurant
data.text: This is our favorite sandwich restaurant in the RGV. It's the go to place for breakfast, and they serve great Mexican food. You will feel at home here.

data.title: Breakfast
data.text: The breakfast was good, the service was also good, Our server was constantly refilling the coffee.  One got the egg filled tacos, and they were good, Huevos Rancheros were also good.

data.title: No Food 45 Minutes After Ordering
data.text:
Diaz is usually a good place to eat.
Good good at reasonable prices with good friendly service, BUT,
we went in about 11:15 am Sunday February 14.
Ordered coffees which appeared quickly, but, the waitress could not tell us which was my wife's Decaf and did not offer to replace the cups.
We each ordered an omelette with toast.
After about 30 minutes, people who had arrived after us were being given their food.
Eventually, after almost 45 minutes, we left our table to leave 
We went to the cash counter, but the woman working the cash was on a phone call.
Finally, I just told her we had waited over 45 minutes with no food arriving and that we were leaving.
She just shrugged her shoulders and continued her phone call.
The staff at this location all appear new, maybe the original staff have been transferred to the new location, if so, the Original Diaz Diner is in trouble.

data.title: So so
data.text: We had to tell a busboy that we were ready to order.  It didn't look that busy.most of the tables had their food. Waitress didn't check with us after we were served. The food was hot but seemed very bland. I  don't think we will go back

data.title: Busy? For lunch
data.text: Very busy and why I have no ideal.  We had lunch special of salmon cakes I believe must have been  deep fried.  We have notice in some cities trip advisor rating are rated to high, I guess folks just like to be nice in the south.

data.title: I went to eat breakfast with my brother.
data.text: The owner new my brother as he is more of a frequent customer that myself.  During the times I have gone, the food is excellent and very reasonably prize.  The service is also very good.

data.title: NICE STOP
data.text: Was in town only a couple of days and came across this diner.  Food was great.  Beans & rice tasted homemade.  Tortillas were also home made.  Crispy tacos were filled with 'seasoned' meat.  Cheese encliladas were great with some lite seasoning.  Staff was friendly & attentive.  I had ordered the deluxe meal which came with 2-tacos, 2-cheese encliladas, 1-chalupa, and rice & beans ($8.99). Even though not on the menu description, I asked for flour tortillas - which they provided at no charge.  Plus, they had both corn & flour chips before the meal.  I had never had the flour chips before -however they were great.  Maybe the flour chips were a little overcooked for my taste but still a nice option.  If in the area again, would stop again and try some other items on their menu.

data.title: Diaz has a new Restaurant in McAllen
data.text: Breakfast was amazing - 2 mornings in a row! We took our Sons and their children.  The staff was very accomadating.

data.title: Tried several times and not good
data.text: I have eaten here several times with a group of seniors from the park where I live and will never go again. Tried the American as well as Mexican dishes and didn't like either.  The hot beef sandwich tasted like the beef had been kept too long and was on the verge of going bad. The enchilada verde was just so so. I don't understand why our "group" continues to go here and seems to like it.

data.title: Great Eating
data.text: Great American and Mexican food.  Their salsa with chips is always a delicious way to begin your meal. It doesn't matter if you go for breakfast, lunch or dinner-the food is always good. The service and prices are reasonable; not expensive by any means. This is one place in Mission, Tx that is always packed!

data.title: My favorite place for Breakfast
data.text: Very friendly staff.  Service is fast and food is not only delicious but consistent.  It is very popular with locals and Winter Texans.  Breakfast tacos are perfect and overstuffed.  They offer daily breakfast specials that are very reasonable.  Coffee is great and flows freely. I have never had to ask for a refill, they are always around.

data.title: lunch
data.text: great place for tex mex and a good mix on the menu. The enchiladas were good and the flour chips are very good

data.title: really good mexican food
data.text: this place has really good food, great breakfast taco's.  Everything is good.  Clean place, nice employee's.
